dlgPart.npc_text:
Proving that man wasn't meant to fly, the ship crashes less than ten minutes after the takeoff.
First one of the engines overheats, conjuring mysterious red symbols over the consoles. The symbols dance and multiply, daring you to do something about it. Ever a <man/woman> of action, you start pulling random levers in the most decisive manner. Oddly enough, this heroic display of taking charge and stepping up to the plate fails to satisfy the Gods.
You hear a deep rumbling sound, warning you that nothing good is coming your way. The ship shakes a few times as if coming apart, then takes a dive and hits the ground hard, throwing you against the wall.
“I can’t believe it...! I mean, you... And then the ship...! And the fire...! Do you have any idea what all of this means?”

dlgAnsw.text: “By the gods, man! I almost died here. Didn’t you see the crash?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
The man’s jaw drops open. He fumbles in the pockets on his robe, looking for something.
You have a feeling that this is the beginning of a very different story and decide to leave it alone for now. You walk away before the man has a chance to say anything.
